ï»¿Execution Version Annex 1 INTERNATIONAL BANK FOR RECONSTRUCTION AND DEVELOPMENT RESOLUTION NO. R2015-0001 THE GLOBAL IYFRASTRUCTURE FACILITY TRUST FUND WHEREAS: (A) It is desirable to promo e the purpose of the International Bank for Reconstru( 0i and Development ("IBRD") by establishing a financial intermediary fund for the Global Infn s tin cture Facility, the Global Infrasiructure Facility Trust Fund ("GIF Trust Fund"), in order t P s pport the establishment and ope 'ations of the Global Infrastructure Facility Partnership Pro,r i (the "GIF") which aims to pro',ide a global platform to enable collective action among a k c e ange of partners, and thereby leverage resources and knowledge to find solutions to cci iplex infrastructure financing challenges that no single institution could achieve alone; (B) The Board of Governors f IBRD on October 11, 2014 adopted a resolution authol i;.i Y the transfer from surplus of U' $15 million to the GIF Trust Fund; (C) Other contributors have al ;o expressed their interest in contributing to the financing o : GIF and to this effect to providr funds to the GIF Trust Fund in support of the GIF; (D) IBRD is prepared to estab ish the GIF Trust Fund, to be the trustee thereof and admin s ei it on the terms and conditions st t forth in this Resolution; NOW THEREFORE it is hereby reso.ved that: 1. Establishment of the GIF "rust Fund 1.1 The International Bank for F econstruction and Development ("IBRD") acting in its cIt city as trustee ("Trustee") will establish the Global Infrastructure Facility ("GIF") ti .ni fund MTO No. 069027 (th- "GIF Trust Fund") to receive financial cont i .ions ("Contributions") and will iold in trust, as legal owner, and administer the funds, a ,e: ' and receipts that constitute the 3JIF Trust Fund, to support the activities of the GIF. h i hout 6

In accepting Contributio i. ) the GIF Trust Fund from any such other Funding Partner, the Trustee will enter into a t L s1 fund administration agreement (an "Administration Agreement") in a form and s.i ance satisfactory to the Trustee. 2. Administration of the Con :ributions 2.1 The Trustee will be respons ble only for performing those functions specifically se c th in this Resolution ("Standard Irovisions") and the Administration Agreements, and wI 13t be subject to any other duties or responsibilities to the Funding Partners, including, -i hout limitation, any duties or obli jations that might otherwise apply to a fiduciary or trusl: nder general principles of trust or fiduciary law. 2.2 The privileges and immuniti.s accorded to IBRD will apply to the property, assets, ici, ives, operations and transactions of the GIF Trust Fund. Nothing in these Standard Provi! i: i nor in the Administration Agr:ement(s) will be considered a waiver of any privi L s or immunities of IBRD under its Articles of Agreement or any applicable law, all of v 1 i are expressly reserved. 3. Commingling, Exchange a id Investment of the Contributions 3.1 The Contributions will be a(-counted for as a single trust fund and will be kept sep, r Af and apart from the funds of IBR D. The Contributions may be commingled with other tL s. fund 7
ï»¿Execution Version assets maintained by IBRD IBRD in its capacity as Trustee, has legal title to t i! unds deposited in the GIF Trust F and. 3.2 The currency in which the ft nds in the GIF Trust Fund will be held is United States I I1 rs or such other currency as may be requested by the Governing Council and agreed t > b the Trustee ("Holding Currenc y"). 3.3 Funding Partners agree to deposit their Contributions in any Holding Currency, or st cLi )ther currency acceptable to the 1 rustee, as stated in their respective Administration Agr , r ents. In the case of deposits receiv ed in a currency other than the Holding Currency, proml ty ipon the receipt of such amount; and the accompanying deposit instructions, the Truct. will convert such amounts into tl e Holding Currency at the exchange rate obtained by the I istee on the date of the conversion. Where deposits prove to be insufficient to complete .t 'ities as a result of exchange rate f luctuations, neither the Trustee nor the Funding Partner . iI bear any responsibility for providing any additional financing. 3.4 The funds deposited in the C IF Trust Fund may be freely exchanged by the Trustee i -o )ther currencies as may facilitate their administration as provided herein at the exchE n , rate obtained by the Trustee on the date of the conversion. 3.5 The Trustee will invest and -einvest the funds deposited in the GIF Trust Fund penc I n their transfer in accordance with the Trustee's applicable policies and procedures for the in S, nent of trust funds administered by the Trustee. The Trustee will credit all income fr > r such investment to the GIF Trust Fund to be used for the purposes of the GIF Trust Fund. 4. Use of GIF Trust Fund Re ;ources 4.1 Subject at all times to avail,.bility of resources within the GIF Trust Fund as deterr r d by the Trustee, the Trustee ma i commit, transfer and/or use the GIF Trust Fund reso [Ic s for any purpose approved and i i the amount allocated and approved by the Governing (I ancil 8
ï»¿Execution Version and/or the GIF Manageme it Unit in accordance with the terms of the GIF Pa -t ,i.ship Framework and subject to P iragraph 6.2, up to the end transfer date to be detennin( c v the Governing Council ("End Transfer Date"). 4.2 Further to paragraph 4.1 abc ve and subject to the availability of applicable resource Id in the GIF Trust Fund as deter nined by the Trustee, the Trustee may commit and trar !;' GIF Trust Fund resources to the "'echnical Partners (as such term is defined in the GIF Pa t i. -ship Framework) in accordance with the financial procedures agreements entered into bet "e. ri the Trustee and each respective rechnical Partner ("Financial Procedures Agreement()' , 4.3 The Financial Procedures kgreement will provide that each Technical Partner + 1 be responsible for: (i) the use of the GIF Trust Fund resources transferred to it and activities carried out t 1:!] with in accordance with (a) its T olicies and procedures, and (b) the applicable decision . f the Governing Council, including the purpose for which the allocations of the GIF Tr [:;t 'und resources have been approv( d; and (ii) reporting to the Governing Council on its activities in accordance with the terr -1: f the GIF Partnership Framework and the GIF Operating Guidelines as approved by the G )i ning Council from time to time (tie "GIF Operating Guidelines"). In addition, recognizing the )bligations of Technical Partner member countries unde v. 1ious United Nations Security Council Resolutions to take measures to prevent fina [,:ii g of terrorists, the Trustee will in clude in each Financial Procedures Agreement that the 1 e;: nical Partner will use reasonable efforts in accordance with the Technical Partners' pol c ic and procedures, to ensure that th - funds provided to the Technical Partner by the Trustee E r used for their intended purposes z nd are not diverted to terrorists or their agents. 4.4 The Trustee will require, anc accept from, the Technical Partners that have received ( I F Frust Fund resources from the Trastee, certain periodic financial reports. The Trustee wA il, Upon request, furnish the Gover ing Council and/or each Funding Partner with copie!c any 9

Each Technical Partner will be responsible for rep. vti ig to the Governing Council on tle use of GIF Trust Fund funds transferred to it, incluc iq! with respect to the activities carricd out with GIF Trust Fund funds pursuant to the GIF Pa t -ship Framework and the GIF Op(rating Guidelines. 5. Reflows and Return of Fuitds by Technical Partners 5.1 The Trustee will receive, by way of transfers of funds from the Technical Partners ) . uant to their respective Financial 3rocedures Agreements, any reflows or return of funds .I .i, are received or held by the Tech iical Partners and due to be returned to the GIF Trust Fu i:1 nder the terms of the relevant 31F funding approved by the Governing Council ar c - the Management Unit in accordance with the terms of the GIF Partnership Frarmew r k. Any reflow or return of funds rec -ived by the Trustee will be credited to the GIF Trust F1 r co be further used for the purpose, of the GIF Trust Fund. 6. Administrative Costs 6.1 Any administrative fees, costs and expenses incurred by each of the Trustee ,r the Management Unit may be covered by GIF Trust Fund resources. Upon approvw I ( 'any proposal by the Governing Council for compensation for administrative fees, c . 1 and expenses pursuant to the ter ns of the GIF Partnership Framework, the Trustee ma) r. asfer to each party the respective amount of compensation approved for that party; prov c that such amount of compensation transferred may be subject to an end of year adjustm< r >ased on actual costs incurred. 10

Accounting and Financial Reporting 7.1 The Trustee will maintain separate records and ledger accounts in respect of t i unds deposited in the GIF Trust F and and transfers made therefrom. 7.2 The Trustee will report to thc Governing Council on the financial status of the GIF Ti .' i "und every six months (or at suct other frequency as the Trustee and the Governing Cou i may agree) in accordance with the provisions set out in the GIF Partnership Frameworl .u I the GIF Operating Guidelines, including information on the status of Contributions, in v nent income, commitments, transfers and funds available for allocation by the Governing C ancil and/or the Management Uni. as applicable. 7.3 The Trustee will provide to the Funding Partners via the World Bank's Trust Fur I 1 onor Center secure website, witl in six (6) months following the end of each fiscal ye i , f the Trustee, an annual single at dit report, comprising (i) a management assertion toge e: with an attestation from the Trust:-e's external auditors concerning the adequacy of intern c. ntrol over cash-based financial reporting for all cash-based trust funds as a whole; a Il ii) a combined financial stateme nt for all cash-based trust funds together with the 'I L tee's external auditor's opinion thereon. The cost of the single audit will be borne by the In tee. 11

The Trustee or. I the Governing Council and/or sL ch individual Funding Partner will agree on the appropri t:! cope and terms of reference of suc -i audit. Following agreement on the scope and terms of ri I nce, the Trustee will arrange foi such external audit. The cost of any such audit incId ill., the internal costs of the Trustee with respect to such audit will be borne by the GIF Trus. FI nd if the audit was requested by tl e Governing Council, or by the requesting Funding Part ii :i f the audit was requested by the Funding Partner. 8. Termination 8.1 The Trustee may terminate ts role as trustee of the GIF Trust Fund at any time aft,r 1 ving the Governing Council six (5) months' notice in writing. Following termination, th< F istee will carry on no business ft r the GIF Trust Fund except for the purpose of windi: i I p its affairs. The Trustee will, in consultation with the Governing Council to the extent '), ible, take all necessary action for winding up its affairs in an expeditious manner, and for r -ting the commitments already n ade by the Trustee and the transfer or return of the [ u: ding Partners' Shares (as defined below) in any remaining funds, assets and receipts in t -. GIF Trust Fund in accordance with paragraphs 9.1 and 9.3. 9. Funding Partner's Share 9.1 Subject to Paragraph 9.2 and where so provided in these Standard Provisions, Fu ding Partners providing Contribul ions to the GIF Trust Fund may receive GIF Trust Fund i ;(I trces in the amount equal to the Funding Partner's Share which will consist of (i) the pro-r ra hare of the outstanding unallocatecd balance of the GIF Trust Fund, including any reflow - turn of other funds received, as o 'the date of calculation, and (ii) the pro-rata share of an u, ount received or released from )revious allocations, in the GIF Trust Fund after the i e of 12

The pro-rata share will be calculated by th< F istee based on the aggregate amount of the Funding Partner's contribution paid to the C [ rust Fund, relative to the aggregz te amount of all Contributions received in the GIF Trus Iu id as at the date of calculation. 9.2 Upon three (3) months' prioi written notice, any Funding Partner providing contribut cn may cancel all or part of the Fu iding Partner's share in the GIF Trust Fund. In the ec en of a cancellation, the Trustee wA ill return to the Funding Partner the amount of the Eu1 ding Partner's Share cancelled, cz lculated as of the date that is three (3) months after the r It by the Trustee of the written nc tice by the Funding Partner, but return such amount on i , and when such resources are m de available to the Trustee. Notwithstanding the foreg rin , the Funding Partner may not ca ncel any part of the Contribution unless the Trustee is s - sfied that there will remain sufficient assets to manage all outstanding obligations under tl IF. 9.3 Following the date that is six (6) months after the delivery of termination noti : nder paragraph 8.1, or after the E id Transfer Date, the Trustee will return to each fundin, Pr tner (except in the case of contrit utions from IBRD, to the International Development As ( L ition ("IDA") the respective Funding Partner's Share in the GIF Trust Fund; provided that t: such return will be made as and when such resources are made available to the Trustee. 10.
